The following inputs are only for advanced plugin functions. They are not important for the connection to the OpenID provider.
Enable this option if you want to use the OJS logon in addition to the OpenID logon.

If you want to encrypt the OpenID information like the OpenID identifier in the HTML code and you want to use the following function for the automated API-KEY generation, you have to enter a secret here. You can choose your secret freely. The more characters, the more secure!

This plugin can generate a key by encrypting the OpenID identifier with the secret you entered before. This key will be encrypted again with a secret that must be specified in the OJS settings. This should be adequately secure.
